body.p:
Sun Set view Jany 18th 1861.
to G. L, Forman & H, Taylor
Dear Sirs

Since I Saw you, your Brother Samuel told me that he met with Mr John Norris at the Louisville Convention, who told him that he was in the Battle on Lake Eerie, and was near me when I was wounded, There ware two of the Norris' in our companty John and Joseph boath clever fellows,
John is now living in Boon County Kentucky, I have written to him today and enquered after his Brother Joseph,

When making the appropriation for the medals you can make It Large enough to cover the expence of at Least Four for the folawing Names James Artus ^Sergeant^ Seargent Wm T. Tali William T, Taliaferro ^corporal^ of cincinnati, John Tucker Private Broun county Ohio and John Norris Boon county Kentucky
I have not heard anything from you yet. But hope when I do, that I may hear, that Kentucky is for the Union the Constitution and the Laws and will continue this, till the Last Hope has failed, and there is no Union to cling to, And then There She may not be in a hurry to joine any confederacy, till She finds an other Government equal to the present, where She will have equal Rights, or remain Independent under her own Government,
we have had no exciting news Sence Saturday,
I have Given you the present residence of the 4 Survivig Volunteers
